author: Slidebean
description:
The biggest problem in AI isn’t software it’s dirt.

Everyone talks about models, but the real bottleneck in AI isn’t code it’s energy, land, and hardware.

OpenAI needs so much infrastructure that SoftBank is investing $3B in an Ohio factory just to support them.

In Patagonia, a rumored $25B data center is underway. Amazon and Microsoft are racing to build their own mega sites too.

And even the biggest chip deals aren’t guaranteed: Nvidia says the rumored $100B partnership with OpenAI is far from confirmed.

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: AI’s biggest constraints are physical, not digital.

author: Slidebean
description:
Grok 5’s scale pushes Elon Musk into chip manufacturing at historic levels.

Elon Musk has revealed Grok 5, a 6 trillion parameter model so large that existing global infrastructure cannot support its training.

Rather than rely solely on Nvidia, Musk is building a new wafer fabrication plant to manufacture tens of billions of AI chips annually, an unprecedented target considering the world produced roughly 1B last year.

With Grok 5 slated for Q1 next year, training has already begun on rapidly deployed hardware.

The move signals Musk’s ambition not just to build advanced AI, but to control the industrial foundation required to power it. 

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: Elon’s new AI model is so big it literally doesn’t fit on Earth
